name: Merfolk
description: Merfolk possess the upper body of a human and the lower body of a fish, allowing for exceptional swimming abilities. They often have scales and coral armor.
memorable: They can breathe both air and water, allowing them to interact with both aquatic and terrestrial environments seamlessly.
goals: Typically protective of their underwater territories and communities, they will fight to defend their homes from intruders.
relations: Often found in communities with other aquatic creatures and able to communicate with adventurers and other beings through shared languages.
environment: Commonly found in oceans, lakes, and deep rivers, especially in underwater cities.
strengths: Highly skilled swimmers with the ability to breathe underwater and air; agile in aquatic settings.
weaknesses: Relatively fragile with low hit points and average physical abilities, making them less effective in direct combat.
attacks: Can use a trident in melee or ranged attacks, providing versatility in combat. They can also perform a damaging Coral Scrape reaction.
most_powerful_ability: Amphibious trait allows them to thrive in both aquatic and terrestrial environments without restrictions.
senses: They have darkvision up to 60 feet and a decent perception skill, allowing them to notice hidden threats.
skills: Possess proficiency in perception with a +2 modifier, making them attentive to their surroundings.
additional_information: Capable of using both ranged and melee attacks with their trident.
Have a bonus action called Nimble Rush for enhanced mobility.
Their rough coral armor can inflict disadvantage on attackers in close quarters.
